body_html:
@isaacgerg +1 to what @guschmue said. Currently we're working to get the Windows build at parity with what the Linux version supports. Our number-one priority is to get all of the kernels building, and you can see a list of the ones we're currently unable to build here. You can also see a list of tests that don't currently pass here. Any contributions to make these work would be most valuable!

Please feel free to open an issue if you run into any problems.
body_text:
@isaacgerg +1 to what @guschmue said. Currently we're working to get the Windows build at parity with what the Linux version supports. Our number-one priority is to get all of the kernels building, and you can see a list of the ones we're currently unable to build here. You can also see a list of tests that don't currently pass here. Any contributions to make these work would be most valuable!
Please feel free to open an issue if you run into any problems.
body:
@isaacgerg +1 to what @guschmue said. Currently we're working to get the Windows build at parity with what the Linux version supports. Our number-one priority is to get all of the kernels building, and you can see a list of the ones we're currently unable to build [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/35f7c5c3fd4fe96b588ba578bbdbc95f47e9ac36/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L88). You can also see a list of tests that don't currently pass [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/35f7c5c3fd4fe96b588ba578bbdbc95f47e9ac36/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_tests.cmake#L129). Any contributions to make these work would be most valuable!

Please feel free to open an issue if you run into any problems.
